Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Announcements

Adult Leader Classes (Take one or two classes each Saturday while the boys are in their classes.)

Saturday, October 27, 2012

  • CPR--$10 per person (no limit to number in class) 9-11:50 a.m. 286 Hinckley (Multi-purpose room)
  • Canyoning, Rapeling 9-10:20 a.m. 245 Hinckley
  • Outdoor Resource Clinic (tour ORC and see what is available for groups to rent) 10:30-11:50 a.m. Meet at the ORC by the Hart stadium--see campus map.

Saturday, November 10, 2012

  • CPR--$10 per person (no limit to number in class) 9-11:50 a.m. 286 Hinckley (Multi-purpose room)
  • Avalanche Safety 9-10:20 a.m. 245 Hinckley
  • Outdoor Cooking 10:30-11:50 a.m. 333 Hinckley

Pow Wow Headquarters will be in the Hinckley foyer this year, rather than in the Taylor. The flag ceremony and the adult activities will be held in the Hinckley building.

NOTE: Due to a conflict with the pool, the Lifesaving Merit Badge will need to run from 8 to 11 a.m. on the first Saturday, only. Please consider this when registering.

What is Merit Badge Pow Wow?

The BYU-Idaho Merit Badge Pow Wow is for all registered Boy Scouts, Varsity Scouts, and Venture Scouts. Scouts may choose up to two merit badges of their choice. There are five merit badges that will last the entire morning during both weeks. They are marked with a  sign on the list provided. Should you choose one of these it will be the only merit badge you take during the Powwow. With any other merit badge choices you will take two merit badge classes and attend the same classes both mornings (in the same order each week).

A flag ceremony will be held at 8:40 a.m. on Saturday, October 29 in the Hinckley chapel and cultural halls. After the flag ceremony, please go directly to your first class. Please do not be late to your classes.

This year we will offer a total of 28 merit badges. After you register, please print off the requirement sheet or sheets below that you will need.

NOTE: Please register your son or Scout for no more than two merit badges. Please make sure that you have one for the first time period and one for the second time period. They will go to the same classes both weeks.

 

* indicates a MB that takes the full morning, both weeks.Cost is $12 for those.

  • Animal Science
  • Art
  • Astronomy
  • Aviation
  • Cit. in Community
  • Cit. in Nation
  • Cit. in World*
  • Communication
  • Crime Prevention
  • Emergency Prep*
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Environmental Science
  • Family Life
  • First Aid*
  • Genealogy
  • Geology
  • Landscape Architecture
  • Law
  • Lifesaving*
  • Music
  • Personal Fitness
  • Personal Management*
  • Photography
  • Public Speaking
  • Reading
  • Sports
  • Swimming
  • Weather

 

When does the Merit Badge Pow Wow take place?

Merit Badge Pow Wow will take place on Saturdays, October 29, 2011, and  November 12, 2011. Please note that there may be requirements that need to be completed prior to or between the weeks of the Pow Wow. Read the requirement sheets and come prepared.

Participation Requirements

Scouts age 11-18 are invited to participate in Merit Badge Pow Wow.

We ask that participants come prepared each Saturday with:

  1. the MB requirement sheets that have  been printed off (see above links)
  2. paper for note taking
  3. a pencil or pen
  4. any items needed to show the counselors.

Cost Information--Price Reduction!!

Merit Badge Pow Wow is $12 per scout.  In the registration process, you will see that this is broken down into two costs of $6.00 for each of the two merit badges you sign up for (making a total of $12 that you pay) or in the case of registering for one of the five merit badges that take the full time, the cost is the full $12. This cost may be paid by a Master Card or Visa. We do not except Discover or American Express.
